sentences.en: Both induction and deduction are essential characteristics of rational thinking.
sentences.cn: 归纳与推论都是理性思维的重要特征.
所有归纳推理都是一种猜测.

sentences.en: His induction as a teacher was a turning point in his life.
sentences.cn: 他就任教师工作是他一生的转折点.

sentences.en: Induction is often used for any inference whose premises do not entail its c onclusions.
sentences.cn: 归纳这个词常被用来指任何前提并不导出其结论的推理.

sentences.en: Mrs Simpson is responsible for the induction of new library staff.
sentences.cn: 辛普森太太负责图书馆新职员的入职培训。

sentences.en: She was told to present herself at the Town Hall at 11.30 for the induction ceremony.
sentences.cn: 她被告知于11点30分在市政厅参加就职仪式。

sentences.en: The induction of a tumor by a virus in vivo can be reproduced in tissue cultures.
sentences.cn: 病毒在体内诱发肿瘤可以在组织培养中再现.

sentences.en: The magnetic signals are sensed by induction coils.
sentences.cn: 磁信号由感应线圈所检测.

sentences.en: The principle of electromagnet induction had thus been discovered.
sentences.cn: 电磁感应定律就是这样发现的.

sentences.en: The wires and detectors are liable to induction from the power lines.
sentences.cn: 导线和检波器易受高压线感应.

sentences.en: They can continue by transfinite induction.
sentences.cn: 利用超限归纳法,他们可继续下去.

sentences.en: This induction process begins a few weeks before fruit bud initiation.
sentences.cn: 这个孕育花芽的过程是在花芽分化前的几个星期开始的.

sentences.en: This is a double induction coil.
To melt the charge, radio frequency ( induction heating ) or resistance heating have been used.
sentences.cn: 为了熔化进料, 可用射频 ( 感应加热 ) 或电阻加热法.

sentences.en: We pass to the induction step.

words.tran_cn: [数] 归纳的；[电] 感应的；诱导的
应召入伍的士兵；就任者
感应器；授职者；圣职授予的人
引导；感应；使…就职；征召入伍
[电磁]感应；[数]归纳法；感应现象

phrases.tran_cn: 电磁感应，电磁效应；感应电流；电磁离合器
感应发电机；异步发电机
感应电动机；异步电动机
直线感应电动机；线性感应电动机
真空感应炉；真空感应电炉

trans.tran_cn: 归纳（法），（电或磁的）感应，诱发，就职，就职典礼
trans.tran_en: the introduction of someone into a new job, company, official position etc, or the ceremony at which this is done
